instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
threads.message:
hi! i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has no power is plugged in.  Liquid damage all over the place. I cleaned it up in the ultrasonic and now I get a green/orange light on the charger but it doesn't boot and the fan doesn't spin. Going through the power rails It seems that I have no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>  at <CAPACITOR>C4807</CAPACITOR> is 2.37v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> at L4807 pin 2 is 2.37v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> at L4011 pin 2 is 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> at J6050 pin 1 is 0v

I replaced <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> because it looked pretty crappy. I've checked around the chip for short to ground and all check out with resistance.  Any ideas of what to look for next? Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
threads.message: I bet <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is not receiving VIN on pin23.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
threads.message: I will check that out as soon as I get back to my shop. thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
threads.message: Is there actually supposed to be a <CHIP>U5540</CHIP> on the production boards for this model? In the schematic I don't see NO STUFF but I don't have <CHIP>U5540</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5440</RESISTOR> on the board.  I don't have another board to compare right now. I do have some donor boards on the way, but they take a long time to arrive.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No power, orange light, no fan
threads.message: It's there but very low. Chasing that down now. Should have checked that first before I posted anything.  I have an orange light on the DC in so I got distracted and went looking the other way.  I'll go through all of the rails in order to see what's up.  thanks
